channel.title: Making mods and admins from character files
channel.description: No its not the idiotic to make mods and admins. Im just want a fix for instead of changing player rights in client, in character files. If anyone has a fix for TestScape base, would be great ;)

item.title: Making mods and admins from character files
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

Oh ffs you get my drift don’t you … ? Whichever method loads your players other data … put Method.playerRights

item.title: Making mods and admins from character files
item.dc:creator: @Legend1 -Legend-
item.description:
@Legend1 wrote:

ownage plz:

public int playerRights = loadgame.playerRights;

Nuuuu

client.java:3957: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable loadgame
location: class client
        public int playerRights = loadgame.playerRights;
                                  ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Making mods and admins from character files
item.dc:creator: @Legend1 -Legend-
item.description:
@Legend1 wrote:

[quote=“ownage plz, post:2, topic:131587”]else if (token.equals("character-rights")) { playerRights = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

and to your saving method add

characterfile.write("character-rights = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(playerRights), 0, Integer.toString(playerRights).length()); characterfile.newLine();[/quote]

No didn’t work lol. Already had second thing, and added first token, compiled no errors, but didn’t work :o

Read full topic
